00002 /* ppport.h -- Perl/Pollution/Portability Version 2.0002
00003  *
00004  * Automatically Created by Devel::PPPort on Tue Jul 13 13:16:39 2004
00005  *
00006  * Do NOT edit this file directly! -- Edit PPPort.pm instead.
00007  *
00008  * Version 2.x, Copyright (C) 2001, Paul Marquess.
00009  * Version 1.x, Copyright (C) 1999, Kenneth Albanowski.
00010  * This code may be used and distributed under the same license as any
00011  * version of Perl.
00012  *
00013  * This version of ppport.h is designed to support operation with Perl
00014  * installations back to 5.004, and has been tested up to 5.8.0.
00015  *
00016  * If this version of ppport.h is failing during the compilation of this
00017  * module, please check if a newer version of Devel::PPPort is available
00018  * on CPAN before sending a bug report.
00019  *
00020  * If you are using the latest version of Devel::PPPort and it is failing
00021  * during compilation of this module, please send a report to perlbug@perl.com
00022  *
00023  * Include all following information:
00024  *
00025  *  1. The complete output from running "perl -V"
00026  *
00027  *  2. This file.
00028  *
00029  *  3. The name & version of the module you were trying to build.
00030  *
00031  *  4. A full log of the build that failed.
00032  *
00033  *  5. Any other information that you think could be relevant.
00034  *
00035  *
00036  * For the latest version of this code, please retreive the Devel::PPPort
00037  * module from CPAN.
00038  *
00039  */
00040 
00041 /*
00042  * In order for a Perl extension module to be as portable as possible
00043  * across differing versions of Perl itself, certain steps need to be taken.
00044  * Including this header is the first major one, then using dTHR is all the
00045  * appropriate places and using a PL_ prefix to refer to global Perl
00046  * variables is the second.
00047  *
00048  */
00049 
00050 
00051 /* If you use one of a few functions that were not present in earlier
00052  * versions of Perl, please add a define before the inclusion of ppport.h
00053  * for a static include, or use the GLOBAL request in a single module to
00054  * produce a global definition that can be referenced from the other
00055  * modules.
00056  *
00057  * Function:            Static define:           Extern define:
00058  * newCONSTSUB()        NEED_newCONSTSUB         NEED_newCONSTSUB_GLOBAL
00059  *
00060  */
00061 
00062 
00063 /* To verify whether ppport.h is needed for your module, and whether any
00064  * special defines should be used, ppport.h can be run through Perl to check
00065  * your source code. Simply say:
00066  *
00067  *      perl -x ppport.h *.c *.h *.xs foo/bar*.c [etc]
00068  *
00069  * The result will be a list of patches suggesting changes that should at
00070  * least be acceptable, if not necessarily the most efficient solution, or a
00071  * fix for all possible problems. It won't catch where dTHR is needed, and
00072  * doesn't attempt to account for global macro or function definitions,
00073  * nested includes, typemaps, etc.
00074  *
00075  * In order to test for the need of dTHR, please try your module under a
00076  * recent version of Perl that has threading compiled-in.
00077  *
00078  */
00079 
00080 
00081 /*
00082 #!/usr/bin/perl
00083 @ARGV = ("*.xs") if !@ARGV;
00084 %badmacros = %funcs = %macros = (); $replace = 0;
00085 foreach (<DATA>) {
00086         $funcs{$1} = 1 if /Provide:\s+(\S+)/;
00087         $macros{$1} = 1 if /^#\s*define\s+([a-zA-Z0-9_]+)/;
00088         $replace = $1 if /Replace:\s+(\d+)/;
00089         $badmacros{$2}=$1 if $replace and /^#\s*define\s+([a-zA-Z0-9_]+).*?\s+([a-zA-Z0-9_]+)/;
00090         $badmacros{$1}=$2 if /Replace (\S+) with (\S+)/;
00091 }
00092 foreach $filename (map(glob($_),@ARGV)) {
00093         unless (open(IN, "<$filename")) {
00094                 warn "Unable to read from $file: $!\n";
00095                 next;
00096         }
00097         print "Scanning $filename...\n";
00098         $c = ""; while (<IN>) { $c .= $_; } close(IN);
00099         $need_include = 0; %add_func = (); $changes = 0;
00100         $has_include = ($c =~ /#.*include.*ppport/m);
00101 
00102         foreach $func (keys %funcs) {
00103                 if ($c =~ /#.*define.*\bNEED_$func(_GLOBAL)?\b/m) {
00104                         if ($c !~ /\b$func\b/m) {
00105                                 print "If $func isn't needed, you don't need to request it.\n" if
00106                                 $changes += ($c =~ s/^.*#.*define.*\bNEED_$func\b.*\n//m);
00107                         } else {
00108                                 print "Uses $func\n";
00109                                 $need_include = 1;
00110                         }
00111                 } else {
00112                         if ($c =~ /\b$func\b/m) {
00113                                 $add_func{$func} =1 ;
00114                                 print "Uses $func\n";
00115                                 $need_include = 1;
00116                         }
00117                 }
00118         }
00119 
00120         if (not $need_include) {
00121                 foreach $macro (keys %macros) {
00122                         if ($c =~ /\b$macro\b/m) {
00123                                 print "Uses $macro\n";
00124                                 $need_include = 1;
00125                         }
00126                 }
00127         }
00128 
00129         foreach $badmacro (keys %badmacros) {
00130                 if ($c =~ /\b$badmacro\b/m) {
00131                         $changes += ($c =~ s/\b$badmacro\b/$badmacros{$badmacro}/gm);
00132                         print "Uses $badmacros{$badmacro} (instead of $badmacro)\n";
00133                         $need_include = 1;
00134                 }
00135         }
00136 
00137         if (scalar(keys %add_func) or $need_include != $has_include) {
00138                 if (!$has_include) {
00139                         $inc = join('',map("#define NEED_$_\n", sort keys %add_func)).
00140                                "#include \"ppport.h\"\n";
00141                         $c = "$inc$c" unless $c =~ s/#.*include.*XSUB.*\n/$&$inc/m;
00142                 } elsif (keys %add_func) {
00143                         $inc = join('',map("#define NEED_$_\n", sort keys %add_func));
00144                         $c = "$inc$c" unless $c =~ s/^.*#.*include.*ppport.*$/$inc$&/m;
00145                 }
00146                 if (!$need_include) {
00147                         print "Doesn't seem to need ppport.h.\n";
00148                         $c =~ s/^.*#.*include.*ppport.*\n//m;
00149                 }
00150                 $changes++;
00151         }
00152 
00153         if ($changes) {
00154                 open(OUT,">/tmp/ppport.h.$$");
00155                 print OUT $c;
00156                 close(OUT);
00157                 open(DIFF, "diff -u $filename /tmp/ppport.h.$$|");
00158                 while (<DIFF>) { s!/tmp/ppport\.h\.$$!$filename.patched!; print STDOUT; }
00159                 close(DIFF);
00160                 unlink("/tmp/ppport.h.$$");
00161         } else {
00162                 print "Looks OK\n";
00163         }
00164 }
00165 __DATA__
00166 */
00167

00265 #ifndef INT2PTR
00266 
00267 #if (IVSIZE == PTRSIZE) && (UVSIZE == PTRSIZE)
00268 #  define PTRV                  UV
00269 #  define INT2PTR(any,d)        (any)(d)
00270 #else
00271 #  if PTRSIZE == LONGSIZE
00272 #    define PTRV                unsigned long
00273 #  else
00274 #    define PTRV                unsigned
00275 #  endif
00276 #  define INT2PTR(any,d)        (any)(PTRV)(d)
00277 #endif
00278 #define NUM2PTR(any,d)  (any)(PTRV)(d)
00279 #define PTR2IV(p)       INT2PTR(IV,p)
00280 #define PTR2UV(p)       INT2PTR(UV,p)
00281 #define PTR2NV(p)       NUM2PTR(NV,p)

00283 #  define PTR2ul(p)     (unsigned long)(p)

00317 #ifndef newRV_noinc
00318 #  ifdef __GNUC__
00319 #    define newRV_noinc(sv)               \
00320       ({                                  \
00321           SV *nsv = (SV*)newRV(sv);       \
00322           SvREFCNT_dec(sv);               \
00323           nsv;                            \
00324       })
00325 #  else
00326 #    if defined(USE_THREADS)
00327 static SV * newRV_noinc (SV * sv)
00328 {
00329           SV *nsv = (SV*)newRV(sv);
00330           SvREFCNT_dec(sv);
00331           return nsv;
00332 }
00333 #    else
00334 #      define newRV_noinc(sv)    \
00335         (PL_Sv=(SV*)newRV(sv), SvREFCNT_dec(sv), (SV*)PL_Sv)

00340 /* Provide: newCONSTSUB */

00342 /* newCONSTSUB from IO.xs is in the core starting with 5.004_63 */
00343 #if (PERL_VERSION < 4) || ((PERL_VERSION == 4) && (PERL_SUBVERSION < 63))
00344 
00345 #if defined(NEED_newCONSTSUB)
00346 static
00347 #else
00348 extern void newCONSTSUB(HV * stash, char * name, SV *sv);
00349 #endif
00350 
00351 #if defined(NEED_newCONSTSUB) || defined(NEED_newCONSTSUB_GLOBAL)
00352 void
00353 newCONSTSUB(stash,name,sv)
00354 HV *stash;
00355 char *name;
00356 SV *sv;
00357 {
00358         U32 oldhints = PL_hints;
00359         HV *old_cop_stash = PL_curcop->cop_stash;
00360         HV *old_curstash = PL_curstash;
00361         line_t oldline = PL_curcop->cop_line;
00362         PL_curcop->cop_line = PL_copline;
00363 
00364         PL_hints &= ~HINT_BLOCK_SCOPE;
00365         if (stash)
00366                 PL_curstash = PL_curcop->cop_stash = stash;
00367 
00368         newSUB(
00369 
00370 #if (PERL_VERSION < 3) || ((PERL_VERSION == 3) && (PERL_SUBVERSION < 22))
00371      /* before 5.003_22 */
00372                 start_subparse(),
00373 #else
00374 #  if (PERL_VERSION == 3) && (PERL_SUBVERSION == 22)
00375      /* 5.003_22 */
00376                 start_subparse(0),
00377 #  else
00378      /* 5.003_23  onwards */
00379                 start_subparse(FALSE, 0),
00380 #  endif
00381 #endif
00382 
00383                 newSVOP(OP_CONST, 0, newSVpv(name,0)),
00384                 newSVOP(OP_CONST, 0, &PL_sv_no),   /* SvPV(&PL_sv_no) == "" -- GMB */
00385                 newSTATEOP(0, Nullch, newSVOP(OP_CONST, 0, sv))
00386         );
00387 
00388         PL_hints = oldhints;
00389         PL_curcop->cop_stash = old_cop_stash;
00390         PL_curstash = old_curstash;
00391         PL_curcop->cop_line = oldline;
00392 }
00393 #endif
00394 
00395 #endif /* newCONSTSUB */
00396 
00397 #ifndef START_MY_CXT
00398 
00399 /*
00400  * Boilerplate macros for initializing and accessing interpreter-local
00401  * data from C.  All statics in extensions should be reworked to use
00402  * this, if you want to make the extension thread-safe.  See ext/re/re.xs
00403  * for an example of the use of these macros.
00404  *
00405  * Code that uses these macros is responsible for the following:
00406  * 1. #define MY_CXT_KEY to a unique string, e.g. "DynaLoader_guts"
00407  * 2. Declare a typedef named my_cxt_t that is a structure that contains
00408  *    all the data that needs to be interpreter-local.
00409  * 3. Use the START_MY_CXT macro after the declaration of my_cxt_t.
00410  * 4. Use the MY_CXT_INIT macro such that it is called exactly once
00411  *    (typically put in the BOOT: section).
00412  * 5. Use the members of the my_cxt_t structure everywhere as
00413  *    MY_CXT.member.
00414  * 6. Use the dMY_CXT macro (a declaration) in all the functions that
00415  *    access MY_CXT.
00416  */
00417 
00418 #if defined(MULTIPLICITY) || defined(PERL_OBJECT) || \
00419     defined(PERL_CAPI)    || defined(PERL_IMPLICIT_CONTEXT)
00420 
00421 /* This must appear in all extensions that define a my_cxt_t structure,
00422  * right after the definition (i.e. at file scope).  The non-threads
00423  * case below uses it to declare the data as static. */
00424 #define START_MY_CXT
00425 
00426 #if (PERL_VERSION < 4 || (PERL_VERSION == 4 && PERL_SUBVERSION < 68 ))
00427 /* Fetches the SV that keeps the per-interpreter data. */
00428 #define dMY_CXT_SV \
00429         SV *my_cxt_sv = perl_get_sv(MY_CXT_KEY, FALSE)
00430 #else /* >= perl5.004_68 */
00431 #define dMY_CXT_SV \
00432         SV *my_cxt_sv = *hv_fetch(PL_modglobal, MY_CXT_KEY,             \
00433                                   sizeof(MY_CXT_KEY)-1, TRUE)
00434 #endif /* < perl5.004_68 */
00435 
00436 /* This declaration should be used within all functions that use the
00437  * interpreter-local data. */
00438 #define dMY_CXT \
00439         dMY_CXT_SV;                                                     \
00440         my_cxt_t *my_cxtp = INT2PTR(my_cxt_t*,SvUV(my_cxt_sv))
00441 
00442 /* Creates and zeroes the per-interpreter data.
00443  * (We allocate my_cxtp in a Perl SV so that it will be released when
00444  * the interpreter goes away.) */
00445 #define MY_CXT_INIT \
00446         dMY_CXT_SV;                                                     \
00447         /* newSV() allocates one more than needed */                    \
00448         my_cxt_t *my_cxtp = (my_cxt_t*)SvPVX(newSV(sizeof(my_cxt_t)-1));\
00449         Zero(my_cxtp, 1, my_cxt_t);                                     \
00450         sv_setuv(my_cxt_sv, PTR2UV(my_cxtp))
00451 
00452 /* This macro must be used to access members of the my_cxt_t structure.
00453  * e.g. MYCXT.some_data */
00454 #define MY_CXT          (*my_cxtp)
00455 
00456 /* Judicious use of these macros can reduce the number of times dMY_CXT
00457  * is used.  Use is similar to pTHX, aTHX etc. */
00458 #define pMY_CXT         my_cxt_t *my_cxtp
00459 #define pMY_CXT_        pMY_CXT,
00460 #define _pMY_CXT        ,pMY_CXT
00461 #define aMY_CXT         my_cxtp
00462 #define aMY_CXT_        aMY_CXT,
00463 #define _aMY_CXT        ,aMY_CXT
00464 
00465 #else /* single interpreter */
00466 
00467 
00468 #define START_MY_CXT    static my_cxt_t my_cxt;
00469 #define dMY_CXT_SV      dNOOP
00470 #define dMY_CXT         dNOOP
00471 #define MY_CXT_INIT     NOOP
00472 #define MY_CXT          my_cxt
00473 
00474 #define pMY_CXT         void
00475 #define pMY_CXT_
00476 #define _pMY_CXT
00477 #define aMY_CXT
00478 #define aMY_CXT_
00479 #define _aMY_CXT
00480 
00481 #endif
00482 
00483 #endif /* START_MY_CXT */
00484 
00485 #ifndef IVdf
00486 #  if IVSIZE == LONGSIZE
00487 #       define  IVdf            "ld"
00488 #       define  UVuf            "lu"
00489 #       define  UVof            "lo"
00490 #       define  UVxf            "lx"
00491 #       define  UVXf            "lX"
00492 #   else
00493 #       if IVSIZE == INTSIZE
00494 #           define      IVdf    "d"
00495 #           define      UVuf    "u"
00496 #           define      UVof    "o"
00497 #           define      UVxf    "x"
00498 #           define      UVXf    "X"
00499 #       endif
00500 #   endif
00501 #endif
00502 
00503 #ifndef NVef
00504 #   if defined(USE_LONG_DOUBLE) && defined(HAS_LONG_DOUBLE) && \
00505         defined(PERL_PRIfldbl) /* Not very likely, but let's try anyway. */
00506 #       define NVef             PERL_PRIeldbl
00507 #       define NVff             PERL_PRIfldbl
00508 #       define NVgf             PERL_PRIgldbl
00509 #   else
00510 #       define NVef             "e"
00511 #       define NVff             "f"
00512 #       define NVgf             "g"
00513 #   endif
00514 #endif

00520 #ifdef SvPVbyte
00521 #   if PERL_REVISION == 5 && PERL_VERSION < 7
00522        /* SvPVbyte does not work in perl-5.6.1, borrowed version for 5.7.3 */
00523 #       undef SvPVbyte
00524 #       define SvPVbyte(sv, lp) \
00525           ((SvFLAGS(sv) & (SVf_POK|SVf_UTF8)) == (SVf_POK) \
00526            ? ((lp = SvCUR(sv)), SvPVX(sv)) : my_sv_2pvbyte(aTHX_ sv, &lp))
00527        static char *
00528        my_sv_2pvbyte(pTHX_ register SV *sv, STRLEN *lp)
00529        {
00530            sv_utf8_downgrade(sv,0);
00531            return SvPV(sv,*lp);
00532        }
00533 #   endif
00534 #else
00535 #   define SvPVbyte SvPV
00536 #endif
